pageTitle: Glue Removal? - by CaptainSkully @ LumberJocks.com ~ woodworking community
textBeforeTable: Show all forums View all topics Start new topic signed in to reply. You must be Have your say... -- You can't control the wind, but you can trim your sails Thanks for all of the “constructive advice” :P Anyhoo, I actually got the glue off by bathing it in boiling water. It eventually gave up the ghost w/o scratching, breaking, etc. I displayed my “save” proudly, and ostentatiously put it back in the cupboard. I’m off to go buy some disposable shop ware. #8 posted 09-11-2008 08:21 PM 1232 posts in 2528 days home | projects | blog CaptainSkully -- Berta in NC You could find out where the gift was purchased and replace the gift.
